macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Market Mixed as Tech Sell-Off Continues
items.summary: The S&P 500 hovered near flatline while the Nasdaq slipped 0.3% on February 4, 2026, as concerns over AI-driven disruption extended the tech sector weakness. The Dow gained 280 points, with energy, consumer staples, and health leading gains.

items.title: AMD Stock Plunges Despite Beating Earnings Expectations
items.summary: AMD shares fell approximately 15% in early trading on February 4 despite beating earnings estimates and providing above-guidance forecasts, triggering broad weakness in the semiconductor sector with the ICE Semi index down roughly 5%.

items.title: Major Tech Earnings Expected: Alphabet and Amazon on Deck
items.summary: Alphabet and Amazon are scheduled to report earnings on February 4-5, 2026, following a volatile week for the technology sector amid renewed concerns about AI-driven market disruption.

items.title: Treasury Market Reacts to Refunding Schedule
items.summary: Long-end Treasury yields rose approximately 2 basis points following the release of the detailed Treasury refunding schedule on February 4, as markets assess potential duration increases.

items.title: Key Economic Data Scheduled for Next Week
items.summary: The BLS will publish the delayed JOLTS report on February 11 at 10 AM EST, followed by the January employment report and CPI data on February 11 and 13, respectively.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges to $73,320 Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Bitcoin declined approximately 3.6% on February 4, 2026, trading around $73,320 as the broader cryptocurrency market experienced significant losses following recent liquidation cascades.

items.title: Crypto Market Crash Wipes $111 Billion in Market Cap
items.summary: A liquidation cascade on February 1st triggered a brutal market correction, with Bitcoin tumbling to the $76,000 range and altcoins experiencing double-digit losses amid US-Iran geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Binance Thailand Lists SENT Trading Pairs
items.summary: Binance TH announced the addition of SENT/USDC and SENT/USDT trading pairs effective February 5, 2026, with deposits and withdrawals beginning at 11:00 AM UTC+7.

items.title: Stablecoin Market Bifurcates Into Regulated and Offshore Tiers
items.summary: The stablecoin market is structurally splitting between regulated, onshore stablecoins for institutional use and offshore liquidity routes optimized for speed and cross-border operations.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Overwatch 2026 Spotlight Reveals New Heroes and Season 1 Launch
items.summary: Blizzard's Overwatch team showcased 2026 plans including new heroes like Jetpack Cat (available for trial February 5th) and Miranda, new story content, gameplay improvements, and Season 1 starting February 10th. Gameplay footage of Jetpack Cat on Midtown was highlighted.

items.title: Nintendo Announces First Direct of 2026: Partner Showcase on February 5th
items.summary: Nintendo revealed a Partner Showcase Direct scheduled for February 5th, sparking predictions for Switch 2 exclusives like Orbitals, Monster Hunter Wilds port, and third-party titles such as Star Wars Outlaws and Assassin's Creed Shadows. Leaks and demos for games like Adventures of Elliot and Olivia are anticipated.

items.title: Nintendo Holiday Sales Exceed Expectations, Raising Switch 2 Launch Concerns
items.summary: Nintendo's strong holiday performance means fewer big system-seller games soon, with no major 2026 titles until at least February's potential Direct, now rumored as a partner showcase only.

items.title: Pokémon Presence at Super Bowl and Potential Gen 10 Teases
items.summary: Discussions highlight Pokémon at the Super Bowl event alongside rumors of new Gen 10 Pokémon forms, starter hints, and Nintendo stock movements tied to upcoming announcements.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: United Airlines Pauses Operations for Major Reservation System Upgrade
items.summary: United Airlines canceled 600 domestic flights on February 4, 2026, for a cloud-based AWS infrastructure upgrade from 2:30 am to 6:00 am EDT, affecting bookings and check-ins. The move aims to improve long-term efficiency despite short-term disruptions.

items.title: Lunar Energy Raises $232M for Grid-Supporting Home Batteries
items.summary: Lunar Energy secured $232 million in funding, bringing total investment over $500 million, to deploy residential batteries forming a distributed power plant to stabilize the grid.

items.title: Positron Raises $230M Series B to Challenge Nvidia's AI Chips
items.summary: Positron secured $230 million in Series B funding from investors including Qatar Investment Authority to develop alternative AI chips amid surging demand beyond Nvidia.

items.title: Massive Chinese Data Breach Spills 8.7 Billion Records
items.summary: A major data breach in China allegedly exposed 8.7 billion records, with over 40,000 WordPress sites affected, raising significant cybersecurity concerns.

items.title: Raspberry Pi Prices Hit Record High Due to RAM Surge
items.summary: The latest Raspberry Pi model features an unprecedented RAM increase, pushing prices to their highest ever and potentially pricing it out of reach for schools and hobbyists.

items.title: Microsoft Ends Some OneDrive and SharePoint Standalone Plans
items.summary: Microsoft is discontinuing certain popular standalone OneDrive and SharePoint plans deemed unprofitable, impacting users of these services.

items.title: China Bans Concealed Car Door Handles Over Safety Issues
items.summary: China prohibited concealed car door handles citing safety risks, targeting designs like Tesla's that have been linked to accidents.
